prompts: A technician is a worker in
baseline: A technician is a worker in a field of technology who is proficient in the relevant skill and technique, with a relatively practical understanding of the theoretical principles.

prompts: The term technician covers many different specialisations
baseline: The term technician covers many different specialisations.

prompts: In the UK , a shortage of skilled technicians in the science , engineering and technology sectors has led to various campaigns
baseline: In the UK, a shortage of skilled technicians in the science, engineering and technology sectors has led to various campaigns to encourage more people to become technicians and to promote the role of technician.

prompts: An electronics technician help design , develop , test ,
baseline: An electronics technician help design, develop, test, manufacture, install, and repair electrical and electronic equipment such as communication equipment, medical monitoring devices, navigational equipment, and computers.

prompts: Naval electronics technicians are the largest group
baseline: Naval electronics technicians are the largest group of engineering technicians in the military (see Electronics Technician (US Navy)).

prompts: ABET - accredited electronics technician programs usually require at least two
baseline: ABET-accredited electronics technician programs usually require at least two mathematics and physics courses besides the core competencies.

prompts: Electronics technician curriculum generally consists of courses in basic electricity and electronics , including Ohm 's Law
baseline: Electronics technician curriculum generally consists of courses in basic electricity and electronics, including Ohm's Law, Parallel and Series Circuits, Magnetism, AC/DC Circuits, Capacitance, Inductance, Transformers, Resonance, Filters, Semiconductors, Transistors, Amplifiers, Integrated Circuits and Digital electronics.

prompts: In addition to vocational learning outcomes associated with the study
baseline: In addition to vocational learning outcomes associated with the study of electronics and control systems, graduates of electronics technician programs are also expected to have essential employability skills and meet certain general education learning outcomes.

prompts: In addition , schools offering electronics technician programs will have electronics laboratories to
baseline: In addition, schools offering electronics technician programs will have electronics laboratories to support the delivery of course curricula.

prompts: An engineering technician is a professional trained in skills and
baseline: An engineering technician is a professional trained in skills and techniques related to a specific branch of technology, with a practical understanding of the relevant engineering concepts.

prompts: The Dublin Accord was signed in 2002 as an international agreement recognizing engineering technician qualifications
baseline: The Dublin Accord was signed in 2002 as an international agreement recognizing engineering technician qualifications.

prompts: An engineering technician at work .
baseline: An engineering technician at work. (1992)

prompts: Engineering technician diplomas and two - year degrees are generally offered by technical schools
baseline: Engineering technician diplomas and two-year degrees are generally offered by technical schools and non-university higher education institutions like colleges of further education, vocational schools, and community colleges.

prompts: However , some university institutions award undergraduate degrees in the engineering field , which may confer the title of
baseline: However, some university institutions award undergraduate degrees in the engineering field, which may confer the title of Engineering technician to the student, who is eligible to become a fully chartered engineer after further studies at the master's degree level.

prompts: Even though the term engineering technician is used throughout , it
baseline: Even though the term engineering technician is used throughout, it is mindful that these roles are often termed differently within specific jurisdictions.

prompts: The individual professional title Certified Technician and post - nominal C.Tech . are protected by provincial legislation
baseline: The individual professional title Certified Technician and post-nominal C.Tech. are protected by provincial legislation and can only be used by registrants certified by engineering and applied science member organizations.

prompts: In the United Kingdom , the term Engineering Technician and post - nominal EngTech are protected in civil law
baseline: In the United Kingdom, the term Engineering Technician and post-nominal EngTech are protected in civil law and can only be used by technicians registered with the Engineering Council UK.

prompts: A laboratory technician is a person who works in a laboratory
baseline: A laboratory technician is a person who works in a laboratory performing analytical or experimental procedures, maintaining laboratory equipment.

prompts: The rating of machinery technician includes the obsolete Coast
baseline: The rating of machinery technician includes the obsolete Coast Guard ratings of engineman (EN), machinist mate (MM), Machinery repairman (MR), and Boiler technician (BT).

prompts: Science technician is a profession involving working as a member
baseline: Science technician is a profession involving working as a member of support staff in any science disciplines.

prompts: The Science Council defines a technician as “ a person who is skilled in the use of particular techniques and procedures to solve practical problems ,
baseline: The Science Council defines a technician as “a person who is skilled in the use of particular techniques and procedures to solve practical problems, often in ways that require considerable ingenuity and creativity.

prompts: A biomedical science technician reviewing a biplate .
baseline: A biomedical science technician reviewing a biplate. (1992)

baseline: There are various awards that can be awarded for science technicians including the Gratnells Science Technician of the Year award.

baseline: Science technician is a profession involving working as a member of support staff in any science disciplines.

prompts: The Science Council defines a technician as “ a person who is skilled in the use of particular techniques and procedures to solve practical problems ,
baseline: The Science Council defines a technician as “a person who is skilled in the use of particular techniques and procedures to solve practical problems, often in ways that require considerable ingenuity and creativity.

prompts: A biomedical science technician reviewing a biplate .
baseline: A biomedical science technician reviewing a biplate. (1992)

prompts: In Germany , where science technicians are a subset of the " technical assistant " class of professions , state - certified technician training is
baseline: In Germany, where science technicians are a subset of the "technical assistant" class of professions, state-certified technician training is a vocational training that lasts between two and three years.

prompts: There are various awards that can be awarded for science technicians
baseline: There are various awards that can be awarded for science technicians including the Gratnells Science Technician of the Year award.

prompts: In Germany , where science technicians are a subset of the " technical assistant " class of professions , state - certified technician training is
baseline: In Germany, where science technicians are a subset of the "technical assistant" class of professions, state-certified technician training is a vocational training that lasts between two and three years.

prompts: In the UK , historically , Science technicians have been able to either
baseline: In the UK, historically, Science technicians have been able to either join the professional body relating to the scientific field in which they work (for example, the Royal Society of Chemistry or the Institute of Physics) or the Institute of Science and Technology which is a professional organisation specifically for technical and specialist staff.

prompts: In the UK , historically , Science technicians have been able to either
baseline: In the UK, historically, Science technicians have been able to either join the professional body relating to the scientific field in which they work (for example, the Royal Society of Chemistry or the Institute of Physics) or the Institute of Science and Technology which is a professional organisation specifically for technical and specialist staff.

prompts: A technician is a worker in
baseline: A technician is a worker in a field of technology who is proficient in the relevant skill and technique, with a relatively practical understanding of the theoretical principles.

prompts: The term technician covers many different specialisations
baseline: The term technician covers many different specialisations.

prompts: In the UK , a shortage of skilled technicians in the science , engineering and technology sectors has led to various campaigns
baseline: In the UK, a shortage of skilled technicians in the science, engineering and technology sectors has led to various campaigns to encourage more people to become technicians and to promote the role of technician.

prompts: A technician is a worker in
baseline: A technician is a worker in a field of technology who is proficient in the relevant skill and technique, with a relatively practical understanding of the theoretical principles.

prompts: In the UK , a shortage of skilled technicians in the science , engineering and technology sectors has led to various campaigns
baseline: In the UK, a shortage of skilled technicians in the science, engineering and technology sectors has led to various campaigns to encourage more people to become technicians and to promote the role of technician.

prompts: An electronics technician help design , develop , test ,
baseline: An electronics technician help design, develop, test, manufacture, install, and repair electrical and electronic equipment such as communication equipment, medical monitoring devices, navigational equipment, and computers.

prompts: Naval electronics technicians are the largest group
baseline: Naval electronics technicians are the largest group of engineering technicians in the military (see Electronics Technician (US Navy)).

prompts: ABET - accredited electronics technician programs usually require at least two
baseline: ABET-accredited electronics technician programs usually require at least two mathematics and physics courses besides the core competencies.

prompts: Electronics technician curriculum generally consists of courses in basic electricity and electronics , including Ohm 's Law
baseline: Electronics technician curriculum generally consists of courses in basic electricity and electronics, including Ohm's Law, Parallel and Series Circuits, Magnetism, AC/DC Circuits, Capacitance, Inductance, Transformers, Resonance, Filters, Semiconductors, Transistors, Amplifiers, Integrated Circuits and Digital electronics.

prompts: In addition to vocational learning outcomes associated with the study
baseline: In addition to vocational learning outcomes associated with the study of electronics and control systems, graduates of electronics technician programs are also expected to have essential employability skills and meet certain general education learning outcomes.

prompts: In addition , schools offering electronics technician programs will have electronics laboratories to
baseline: In addition, schools offering electronics technician programs will have electronics laboratories to support the delivery of course curricula.

prompts: Electronics technicians may also work as sales workers or field representatives for manufacturers , wholesalers , or retailers giving advice on the
baseline: Electronics technicians may also work as sales workers or field representatives for manufacturers, wholesalers, or retailers giving advice on the installation, operation, and maintenance of complex equipment and may write specifications and technical manuals.

prompts: Most employers prefer to hire electronics
baseline: Most employers prefer to hire electronics technicians with an associate degree or other post-secondary education in engineering technology.

prompts: Many 2 - year associate degree programs accredited by the Technology
baseline: Many 2-year associate degree programs accredited by the Technology Accreditation Commission of the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology include at least college algebra and trigonometry and one or two introductory science courses.

prompts: About 200 ABET - accredited programs are offered in engineering technology
baseline: About 200 ABET-accredited programs are offered in engineering technology specialties.

prompts: An electronics technician help design , develop , test ,
baseline: An electronics technician help design, develop, test, manufacture, install, and repair electrical and electronic equipment such as communication equipment, medical monitoring devices, navigational equipment, and computers.

prompts: Electronics technicians may also work as sales workers or field representatives for manufacturers , wholesalers , or retailers giving advice on the
baseline: Electronics technicians may also work as sales workers or field representatives for manufacturers, wholesalers, or retailers giving advice on the installation, operation, and maintenance of complex equipment and may write specifications and technical manuals.

prompts: Electronics technicians represent over 33 %
baseline: Electronics technicians represent over 33% of all engineering technicians in the U.S.

prompts: Electronics technicians are accredited by organizations such
baseline: Electronics technicians are accredited by organizations such as the Electronics Technicians Association, or International Society of Certified Electronics Technicians.

prompts: Most employers prefer to hire electronics
baseline: Most employers prefer to hire electronics technicians with an associate degree or other post-secondary education in engineering technology.

prompts: Naval electronics technicians are the largest group
baseline: Naval electronics technicians are the largest group of engineering technicians in the military (see Electronics Technician (US Navy)).

prompts: ABET - accredited electronics technician programs usually require at least two
baseline: ABET-accredited electronics technician programs usually require at least two mathematics and physics courses besides the core competencies.

prompts: Electronics technician curriculum generally consists of courses in basic electricity and electronics , including Ohm 's Law
baseline: Electronics technician curriculum generally consists of courses in basic electricity and electronics, including Ohm's Law, Parallel and Series Circuits, Magnetism, AC/DC Circuits, Capacitance, Inductance, Transformers, Resonance, Filters, Semiconductors, Transistors, Amplifiers, Integrated Circuits and Digital electronics.

prompts: In addition to vocational learning outcomes associated with the study
baseline: In addition to vocational learning outcomes associated with the study of electronics and control systems, graduates of electronics technician programs are also expected to have essential employability skills and meet certain general education learning outcomes.

prompts: These lab courses and projects often represent up to 50
baseline: These lab courses and projects often represent up to 50% of the course material and are used to reinforce theoretical concepts associated with the study of electronics.

prompts: In addition , schools offering electronics technician programs will have electronics laboratories to
baseline: In addition, schools offering electronics technician programs will have electronics laboratories to support the delivery of course curricula.

prompts: Historically , these laboratories have been traditional " hands - on " learning environments , although
baseline: Historically, these laboratories have been traditional "hands-on" learning environments, although, in recent years, the trend is moving towards electronics simulation software such as Multisim and CircuitLogix.

prompts: Electronics software simulation is also used in conjunction with traditional labs to provide more significant opportunities
baseline: Electronics software simulation is also used in conjunction with traditional labs to provide more significant opportunities for students to complete laboratory projects as part of their studies.

prompts: The demand for jobs in the electronics engineering and service fields is the result of
baseline: The demand for jobs in the electronics engineering and service fields is the result of a recent proliferation of both consumer and industrial electronics products.

prompts: The design , installation , servicing and maintenance of this equipment has created significant employment opportunities
baseline: The design, installation, servicing and maintenance of this equipment has created significant employment opportunities in the electronics industry.

prompts: Job opportunities for electrical and electronics technicians are increasing because many industries
baseline: Job opportunities for electrical and electronics technicians are increasing because many industries use electronic products and systems.

prompts: Employment opportunities for electronics technicians vary and are largely based on their areas
baseline: Employment opportunities for electronics technicians vary and are largely based on their areas of expertise.

prompts: For example , employment growth for Electronics technicians in areas such as robotics , energy conversion , and power generation is expected to grow by
baseline: For example, employment growth for Electronics technicians in areas such as robotics, energy conversion, and power generation is expected to grow by 5%/yr from 2010 through 2020.

prompts: An electronics technician help design , develop , test ,
baseline: An electronics technician help design, develop, test, manufacture, install, and repair electrical and electronic equipment such as communication equipment, medical monitoring devices, navigational equipment, and computers.

prompts: They may be employed in product evaluation and testing , using measuring and diagnostic
baseline: They may be employed in product evaluation and testing, using measuring and diagnostic devices to adjust, test, and repair equipment.

prompts: An engineering technician is a professional trained in skills and
baseline: An engineering technician is a professional trained in skills and techniques related to a specific branch of technology, with a practical understanding of the relevant engineering concepts.

prompts: The Dublin Accord was signed in 2002 as an international agreement recognizing engineering technician qualifications
baseline: The Dublin Accord was signed in 2002 as an international agreement recognizing engineering technician qualifications.

prompts: An engineering technician at work .
baseline: An engineering technician at work. (1992)

prompts: Engineering technician diplomas and two - year degrees are generally offered by technical schools
baseline: Engineering technician diplomas and two-year degrees are generally offered by technical schools and non-university higher education institutions like colleges of further education, vocational schools, and community colleges.

prompts: However , some university institutions award undergraduate degrees in the engineering field , which may confer the title of
baseline: However, some university institutions award undergraduate degrees in the engineering field, which may confer the title of Engineering technician to the student, who is eligible to become a fully chartered engineer after further studies at the master's degree level.

prompts: Even though the term engineering technician is used throughout , it
baseline: Even though the term engineering technician is used throughout, it is mindful that these roles are often termed differently within specific jurisdictions.

prompts: The individual professional title Certified Technician and post - nominal C.Tech . are protected by provincial legislation
baseline: The individual professional title Certified Technician and post-nominal C.Tech. are protected by provincial legislation and can only be used by registrants certified by engineering and applied science member organizations.

prompts: In the United Kingdom , the term Engineering Technician and post - nominal EngTech are protected in civil law
baseline: In the United Kingdom, the term Engineering Technician and post-nominal EngTech are protected in civil law and can only be used by technicians registered with the Engineering Council UK.

prompts: Engineering technicians help solve technical problems
baseline: Engineering technicians help solve technical problems in many ways.

prompts: They may also be people who produce technical drawings or
baseline: They may also be people who produce technical drawings or engineering drawings.

prompts: Engineering technician diplomas and two - year degrees are generally offered by technical schools
baseline: Engineering technician diplomas and two-year degrees are generally offered by technical schools and non-university higher education institutions like colleges of further education, vocational schools, and community colleges.

prompts: Professionals attain the title with the award of a short - cycle three- to four -
baseline: Professionals attain the title with the award of a short-cycle three- to four-year undergraduate degree (associate degree or bachelor's degree) in a technical engineering field from colleges or technical engineering institutes (in Portugal) and (in Spain), from universities.

prompts: Spanish " technical engineers " have full competency in their respective professional fields of engineering , being the difference that the three or four - year Engineers have competence only in
baseline: Spanish "technical engineers" have full competency in their respective professional fields of engineering, being the difference that the three or four-year Engineers have competence only in their specialty (Mechanical, Electrical, Chemical, etc.), and the "Engineering Superior School" Engineers have wider competencies.

prompts: An engineering technician is a professional trained in skills and
baseline: An engineering technician is a professional trained in skills and techniques related to a specific branch of technology, with a practical understanding of the relevant engineering concepts.

prompts: Many four - year colleges and universities offer bachelor 's degrees
baseline: Many four-year colleges and universities offer bachelor's degrees in engineering technology but engineering technologists are somewhat different from engineering technicians.

prompts: In the United States , the engineering technology accreditation commission ( ETAC ) of the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology ( ABET ) grants two - year
baseline: In the United States, the engineering technology accreditation commission (ETAC) of the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET) grants two-year associate degree programs to students that meet a set of specified standards.

prompts: The nine provincial professional associations are unified federally through Technology
baseline: The nine provincial professional associations are unified federally through Technology Professionals Canada, which advocates for the profession within the provincial associations and respective regulatory bodies.

prompts: There are multiple fields in
baseline: There are multiple fields in this job such as; software design, repair, etc.

baseline: A laboratory technician is a person who works in a laboratory performing analytical or experimental procedures, maintaining laboratory equipment.

baseline: About 200 ABET-accredited programs are offered in engineering technology specialties.

prompts: An electronics technician help design , develop , test ,
baseline: An electronics technician help design, develop, test, manufacture, install, and repair electrical and electronic equipment such as communication equipment, medical monitoring devices, navigational equipment, and computers.

prompts: Electronics technicians may also work as sales workers or field representatives for manufacturers , wholesalers , or retailers giving advice on the
baseline: Electronics technicians may also work as sales workers or field representatives for manufacturers, wholesalers, or retailers giving advice on the installation, operation, and maintenance of complex equipment and may write specifications and technical manuals.

prompts: Electronics technicians represent over 33 %
baseline: Electronics technicians represent over 33% of all engineering technicians in the U.S.

prompts: Electronics technicians are accredited by organizations such
baseline: Electronics technicians are accredited by organizations such as the Electronics Technicians Association, or International Society of Certified Electronics Technicians.

prompts: Most employers prefer to hire electronics
baseline: Most employers prefer to hire electronics technicians with an associate degree or other post-secondary education in engineering technology.

prompts: Naval electronics technicians are the largest group
baseline: Naval electronics technicians are the largest group of engineering technicians in the military (see Electronics Technician (US Navy)).

prompts: ABET - accredited electronics technician programs usually require at least two
baseline: ABET-accredited electronics technician programs usually require at least two mathematics and physics courses besides the core competencies.

prompts: Electronics technician curriculum generally consists of courses in basic electricity and electronics , including Ohm 's Law
baseline: Electronics technician curriculum generally consists of courses in basic electricity and electronics, including Ohm's Law, Parallel and Series Circuits, Magnetism, AC/DC Circuits, Capacitance, Inductance, Transformers, Resonance, Filters, Semiconductors, Transistors, Amplifiers, Integrated Circuits and Digital electronics.

prompts: In addition to vocational learning outcomes associated with the study
baseline: In addition to vocational learning outcomes associated with the study of electronics and control systems, graduates of electronics technician programs are also expected to have essential employability skills and meet certain general education learning outcomes.

prompts: These lab courses and projects often represent up to 50
baseline: These lab courses and projects often represent up to 50% of the course material and are used to reinforce theoretical concepts associated with the study of electronics.

prompts: In addition , schools offering electronics technician programs will have electronics laboratories to
baseline: In addition, schools offering electronics technician programs will have electronics laboratories to support the delivery of course curricula.

prompts: Historically , these laboratories have been traditional " hands - on " learning environments , although
baseline: Historically, these laboratories have been traditional "hands-on" learning environments, although, in recent years, the trend is moving towards electronics simulation software such as Multisim and CircuitLogix.

prompts: Electronics software simulation is also used in conjunction with traditional labs to provide more significant opportunities
baseline: Electronics software simulation is also used in conjunction with traditional labs to provide more significant opportunities for students to complete laboratory projects as part of their studies.

prompts: The demand for jobs in the electronics engineering and service fields is the result of
baseline: The demand for jobs in the electronics engineering and service fields is the result of a recent proliferation of both consumer and industrial electronics products.

prompts: The design , installation , servicing and maintenance of this equipment has created significant employment opportunities
baseline: The design, installation, servicing and maintenance of this equipment has created significant employment opportunities in the electronics industry.

prompts: Job opportunities for electrical and electronics technicians are increasing because many industries
baseline: Job opportunities for electrical and electronics technicians are increasing because many industries use electronic products and systems.

prompts: Employment opportunities for electronics technicians vary and are largely based on their areas
baseline: Employment opportunities for electronics technicians vary and are largely based on their areas of expertise.

prompts: For example , employment growth for Electronics technicians in areas such as robotics , energy conversion , and power generation is expected to grow by
baseline: For example, employment growth for Electronics technicians in areas such as robotics, energy conversion, and power generation is expected to grow by 5%/yr from 2010 through 2020.

prompts: An electronics technician help design , develop , test ,
baseline: An electronics technician help design, develop, test, manufacture, install, and repair electrical and electronic equipment such as communication equipment, medical monitoring devices, navigational equipment, and computers.

prompts: They may be employed in product evaluation and testing , using measuring and diagnostic
baseline: They may be employed in product evaluation and testing, using measuring and diagnostic devices to adjust, test, and repair equipment.

prompts: An engineering technician is a professional trained in skills and
baseline: An engineering technician is a professional trained in skills and techniques related to a specific branch of technology, with a practical understanding of the relevant engineering concepts.

prompts: The Dublin Accord was signed in 2002 as an international agreement recognizing engineering technician qualifications
baseline: The Dublin Accord was signed in 2002 as an international agreement recognizing engineering technician qualifications.

prompts: An engineering technician at work .
baseline: An engineering technician at work. (1992)

prompts: Engineering technician diplomas and two - year degrees are generally offered by technical schools
baseline: Engineering technician diplomas and two-year degrees are generally offered by technical schools and non-university higher education institutions like colleges of further education, vocational schools, and community colleges.

prompts: However , some university institutions award undergraduate degrees in the engineering field , which may confer the title of
baseline: However, some university institutions award undergraduate degrees in the engineering field, which may confer the title of Engineering technician to the student, who is eligible to become a fully chartered engineer after further studies at the master's degree level.

prompts: Even though the term engineering technician is used throughout , it
baseline: Even though the term engineering technician is used throughout, it is mindful that these roles are often termed differently within specific jurisdictions.

prompts: The individual professional title Certified Technician and post - nominal C.Tech . are protected by provincial legislation
baseline: The individual professional title Certified Technician and post-nominal C.Tech. are protected by provincial legislation and can only be used by registrants certified by engineering and applied science member organizations.

prompts: In the United Kingdom , the term Engineering Technician and post - nominal EngTech are protected in civil law
baseline: In the United Kingdom, the term Engineering Technician and post-nominal EngTech are protected in civil law and can only be used by technicians registered with the Engineering Council UK.

prompts: Engineering technicians help solve technical problems
baseline: Engineering technicians help solve technical problems in many ways.

prompts: They may also be people who produce technical drawings or
baseline: They may also be people who produce technical drawings or engineering drawings.

prompts: Engineering technician diplomas and two - year degrees are generally offered by technical schools
baseline: Engineering technician diplomas and two-year degrees are generally offered by technical schools and non-university higher education institutions like colleges of further education, vocational schools, and community colleges.

prompts: Professionals attain the title with the award of a short - cycle three- to four -
baseline: Professionals attain the title with the award of a short-cycle three- to four-year undergraduate degree (associate degree or bachelor's degree) in a technical engineering field from colleges or technical engineering institutes (in Portugal) and (in Spain), from universities.

prompts: Spanish " technical engineers " have full competency in their respective professional fields of engineering , being the difference that the three or four - year Engineers have competence only in
baseline: Spanish "technical engineers" have full competency in their respective professional fields of engineering, being the difference that the three or four-year Engineers have competence only in their specialty (Mechanical, Electrical, Chemical, etc.), and the "Engineering Superior School" Engineers have wider competencies.

prompts: An engineering technician is a professional trained in skills and
baseline: An engineering technician is a professional trained in skills and techniques related to a specific branch of technology, with a practical understanding of the relevant engineering concepts.

prompts: Many four - year colleges and universities offer bachelor 's degrees
baseline: Many four-year colleges and universities offer bachelor's degrees in engineering technology but engineering technologists are somewhat different from engineering technicians.

prompts: In the United States , the engineering technology accreditation commission ( ETAC ) of the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology ( ABET ) grants two - year
baseline: In the United States, the engineering technology accreditation commission (ETAC) of the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET) grants two-year associate degree programs to students that meet a set of specified standards.

prompts: The nine provincial professional associations are unified federally through Technology
baseline: The nine provincial professional associations are unified federally through Technology Professionals Canada, which advocates for the profession within the provincial associations and respective regulatory bodies.

prompts: There are multiple fields in
baseline: There are multiple fields in this job such as; software design, repair, etc.

prompts: A laboratory technician is a person who works in a laboratory
baseline: A laboratory technician is a person who works in a laboratory performing analytical or experimental procedures, maintaining laboratory equipment.

prompts: The rating of machinery technician includes the obsolete Coast
baseline: The rating of machinery technician includes the obsolete Coast Guard ratings of engineman (EN), machinist mate (MM), Machinery repairman (MR), and Boiler technician (BT).

prompts: The rating of machinery technician includes the obsolete Coast
baseline: The rating of machinery technician includes the obsolete Coast Guard ratings of engineman (EN), machinist mate (MM), Machinery repairman (MR), and Boiler technician (BT).

prompts: Science technician is a profession involving working as a member
baseline: Science technician is a profession involving working as a member of support staff in any science disciplines.

prompts: The Science Council defines a technician as “ a person who is skilled in the use of particular techniques and procedures to solve practical problems ,
baseline: The Science Council defines a technician as “a person who is skilled in the use of particular techniques and procedures to solve practical problems, often in ways that require considerable ingenuity and creativity.

prompts: A biomedical science technician reviewing a biplate .
baseline: A biomedical science technician reviewing a biplate. (1992)

prompts: In Germany , where science technicians are a subset of the " technical assistant " class of professions , state - certified technician training is
baseline: In Germany, where science technicians are a subset of the "technical assistant" class of professions, state-certified technician training is a vocational training that lasts between two and three years.

prompts: There are various awards that can be awarded for science technicians
baseline: There are various awards that can be awarded for science technicians including the Gratnells Science Technician of the Year award.

prompts: In Germany , where science technicians are a subset of the " technical assistant " class of professions , state - certified technician training is
baseline: In Germany, where science technicians are a subset of the "technical assistant" class of professions, state-certified technician training is a vocational training that lasts between two and three years.

prompts: In the UK , historically , Science technicians have been able to either
baseline: In the UK, historically, Science technicians have been able to either join the professional body relating to the scientific field in which they work (for example, the Royal Society of Chemistry or the Institute of Physics) or the Institute of Science and Technology which is a professional organisation specifically for technical and specialist staff.

prompts: In the UK , historically , Science technicians have been able to either
baseline: In the UK, historically, Science technicians have been able to either join the professional body relating to the scientific field in which they work (for example, the Royal Society of Chemistry or the Institute of Physics) or the Institute of Science and Technology which is a professional organisation specifically for technical and specialist staff.
